Comment: I am playing the Bishop Opening against the computer on a higher level where this is my first good result. I evaluated various alternatives and found a few good moves which produce a sound opening. Symbols I use: ^ with the idea of, --> target, tactical significance, -/-> refutes or counters an oppoent idea, and then the usual ! ? + - = symbols.

I am playing the Bishop Opening against the computer on a higher level where this is my first good result. I evaluated various alternatives and found a few good moves which produce a sound opening. Symbols I use: ^ with the idea of, --> target, tactical significance, -/-> refutes or counters an oppoent idea, and then the usual ! ? + - = symbols.
I have reviewed a Kasparov game where he played d3, and even though my game deviates for black because the computer plays the reasonably strong ...Nc6, I do like this move.
The computer wastes no time in castling.
My strategy is to attack kingside because that is where black is assumed to be castling. I want to obtain 0-0-0 so I can play a kingside pawn storm.
!? The idea is to weaken any central strong points for black and to open up some lines that I hope to use to advantage.
!? The idea is to weaken any central strong points for black and to open up some lines that I hope to use to advantage.

Now material is cleared and there is only a single black knight, which I consider to reduce good counterplay by black. But the computer does try to generate some threats over the next few moves, but it is not considering the position that deeply.

A strong move where black fights to gain better control of the center while gaining some tempo. I saw Qd1 as a reply, but was considering playing the queen on the kingside and did not want to risk an early queen trade.
!? An unusual looking move with the idea of Qg3 after ...d6
?! The computer makes a positionally unsound move which allows good counterplay by white.

! Not trading bishops and so not opening up a half open file for the rook.

The computer continues to play with aggressive attacking kingside play, but it seems like it should be playing more on the queenside. ...Nf4 attacking the bishop is a consideration after the queen moves away.
? Missing the better ...Nf4, this move is weak and is refuted easily.
? Missing the better ...Nf4, this move is weak and is refuted easily.
? Another unsound move which probably hopes for the weak reply of Bxg5 followed by ...Qxg5 and a good game for black.

Now looked like a good time to castle because the d file could be opened up and I did not want my king to be caught in the center. This move enables 0-0-0.
